alert.note: Alert for Bowie; Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 11:41PM CDT until April 05 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Southeastern McCurtain County in southeastern Oklahoma... Central Franklin County in northeastern Texas... Western Bowie County in northeastern Texas... Northern Morris County in northeastern Texas... Titus County in northeastern Texas... Southeastern Red River County in northeastern Texas... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1141 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Clarksville to near Wilkerson to near Purley, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Clarksville, Boxelder, Mount Vernon, De Kalb, Naples, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Cookville, Wilkerson, Purley, Dalby Springs, Cason, Winfield, Talco, Avery, Annona, Haworth, Miller`s Cove and Moon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Texas. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Texas.
